body_content.explanation: a position in yoga in which a person has their hands and feet on the floor with the front of their body facing the floor, legs stretched out behind them and slightly raised from the floor, arms and upper back straight, and head held high:
examples: I started the day with my usual yoga stretches - downward-facing dog, upward-facing dog, a few salutations to the sun and the obligatory headstand.
With each pose she called out - the upward dog, the bow and arrow, the kitchen table - they immediately knew what to do.
